case_vignette: A 34-year-old male presents with history of itching all over the body ongoing for the past year. He does not take any medications other than multivitamins. He denies any history of skin conditions. He has tried fexofenadine in the past which helped, but over the counter hydrocortisone only provides minimal relief. Pruritus is worse around areas of tight clothing contacting his skin that occurs within a few minutes. Skin examination reveals linear urticaria on the upper back that develop after two minutes in areas of gentle scratching with a cotton tip applicator.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having itching all over my body for the past year.
Have you noticed any rashes or bumps on your skin?
Yes, I get these line-shaped rashes on my upper back after gentle scratching.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as redness, swelling, or pain?
Just the itching; I haven't noticed redness, swelling or pain.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin color or texture?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in color or texture of my skin.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or appetite?
No, my weight and appetite have remained the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your energy levels or sleep patterns?
No, my energy levels and sleep patterns haven't changed.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or mental health?
No, my mood and mental health have been the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your medical history or medications?
I don't have any other medical history, and I only take multivitamins.
Have you noticed any changes in your family history?
No, there have been no changes in my family history.
Final Diagnosis: Atopic Dermatitis.
